body:
### Rationale

Spack should at least give a warning (or, better, don't even try) when a package specified as a provider for some virtual package but doesn't provide that package.

### Description

With a large stack (environment) concretization can take infinite time (never completes but doesn't fail with stack overflow or some other error) if a package specified as a provider for some virtual package but doesn't provide that package.

title: Complain if "invalid" package specified as provider for virtual package
